headline.main: What Is the State of Your Block?

docs.snippet: With Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg's State of the City Address scheduled for Thursday, City Room is asking readers to provide a local perspective....
docs.abstract: With Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg's State of the City Address scheduled for Thursday, City Room is asking readers to provide a local perspective.
docs.lead_paragraph: Thursday at 1 p.m., Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg will give his annual State of the City Address. He can be expected to tout the year's successes and promote his administration's policies and plans going forward. City Room will cover it live with a video feed and tweets from our reporters and editors.

docs.abstract: A gay hockey blog is featuring a notable series of posts about a high school player's experiences that are more about hockey than they are about being a gay hockey player.
docs.lead_paragraph: Puck Buddys, the gay hockey blog that recently celebrated its one-year anniversary as the site "for boys who like boys who like hockey," has begun a new series of posts that exemplify why it has become an important trailblazer in the game's cybersphere.

headline.main: How to Use an iPod Underwater

docs.snippet: Demonstrating a new technology, WaterBlock - a coating applied directly to the insides of gadgets - makes them impervious to water damage....
docs.abstract: Demonstrating a new technology, WaterBlock - a coating applied directly to the insides of gadgets - makes them impervious to water damage.

headline.main: How to Use an iPod Underwater

docs.snippet: Demonstrating a new technology, WaterBlock - a coating applied directly to the insides of gadgets - makes them impervious to water damage....
docs.abstract: Demonstrating a new technology, WaterBlock - a coating applied directly to the insides of gadgets - makes them impervious to water damage.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS - The most astonishing products here at the International Consumer Electronics Show are often the ones you can't buy yet, like a process called WaterBlock from the company HzO. In a demonstration, an iPod with the WaterBlock treatment - not enclosed in any kind of case or covering - was dropped in a fish tank while playing, and it played on undisturbed for hours.

headline.main: New York Philharmonic Interrupted by Chimes Mahler Never Intended

docs.snippet: Alan Gilbert, the conductor of the New York Philharmonic, halted the orchestra and made everyone wait when the cellphone belonging to a member of the audience at Tuesday night's concert began to ring and ring and ring during the final movement of ...

keywords.value: Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Alan Gilbert, the conductor of the New York Philharmonic, halted the orchestra and made everyone wait when the cellphone belonging to a member of the audience at Tuesday night's concert began to ring and ring and ring during the final movement of Mahler's Ninth Symphony.
docs.lead_paragraph: The end of Mahler's Ninth Symphony contains some of the most spiritual and peaceful music ever written. So when a cellphone began ringing - and ringing, ringing, ringing without cease - during a performance by the New York Philharmonic on Tuesday evening, Alan Gilbert did something conductors virtually never do. He stopped the performance.
